frame.name: Convoy
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Convoy</fen> consists of several <fen>Vehicles</fen> which move together to transport <fen>Cargo</fen> from a Source to a Goal.
<ex>A <t><fex name="con">convoy</fex></t> <fex name="veh">of several dozen vehicles</fex> was stopped at the border for several hours while border guards inspected their cargo.</ex>
<ex>Trained gunmen hijacked a <fex name="car">medical supply</fex> <t><fex name="con">convoy</fex></t> headed for the city.</ex>
<ex>The <fex name="dir">southbound</fex> <t><fex name="con">convoy</fex></t> <fex name="veh">of two vans and several armored vehicles</fex> arrived safely 10 hours after it had departed.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Vehicles
FE.definition:
<def-root>The constituent vehicles that make up the <fen>Convoy</fen>.
<ex>Trained gunmen hijacked a <fex name="veh">20-car</fex> <t>convoy</t> headed for the city.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Convoy
FE.definition:
<def-root>The group of vehicles transporting the <fen>Cargo</fen>.
<ex>The southbound <t><fex name="con">convoy</fex></t> of two vans and several armored vehicles arrived safely 10 hours after it had departed.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Aggregate_property
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE describes a property of the <fen>Convoy</fen> rather than the <fen>Vehicles</fen> and is used to tag the adjective that modifies the aggregate noun when it is unambiguous.</def-root>

FE.name: Name
FE.definition: <def-root>The term used to refer to the <fen>Convoy</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Domain
FE.definition: <def-root>The relevant <fen>Domain</fen> as it pertains to the <fen>Convoy</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Possessor
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Possessor</fen> of the <fen>Convoy</fen>. Often a nation or organization that wants the <fen>Cargo</fen> transported.
<ex>Recent attacks on <fex name="pos">NATO</fex> <t>convoys</t> have not helped the ongoing peace talks.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Cargo
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Cargo</fen> are the goods and/or individuals transported by the <fen>Convoy</fen>. This FE also covers the intended use of the transported goods.
<ex>Trained gunmen hijacked a <fex name="car">medical supply</fex> <t>convoy</t> headed for the city.</ex>
<ex><fex name="car">Aid</fex> <t>convoys</t> traveled through the city, mostly unharmed.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Source
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Source</fen> is the beginning of the path along which the <fen>Convoy</fen> travels.</def-root>

FE.name: Goal
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Goal</fen> is the endpoint of path along which the <fen>Convoy</fen> travels.</def-root>

FE.name: Direction
FE.definition:
<def-root>The direction in which the <fen>Convoy</fen> travels.
<ex>All <fex name="dir">northbound</fex> <t>convoys</t> are to be redirected.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Support
FE.definition:
<def-root>People and possibly other elements of the convoy who support and defend the transport of the <fen>Cargo</fen> are the <fen>Support</fen>. In military contexts, this typically consists of soldiers and military vehicles who provide defense for the conveying <fen>Vehicles</fen> and <fen>Cargo</fen>.
<ex>A military <t>convoy</t> <fex name="sup">of rebel gunmen</fex> stood between us and a large cache of weapons.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The general Place where the <fen>Convoy</fen> is operating.
<ex><t>Convoys</t> <fex name="pla">in Afghanistan</fex> have been hardest hit.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: convoy.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a group of vehicles transporting items.

lexUnit.name: train.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a collection of vehicles and possibly individuals for transporting items.
